title: Time to buckle up: Your guide to Colorado's ski resorts
text:
Time to buckle up: Your guide to Colorado's ski resorts Stephen Meyers , stephenmeyers@coloradoan.com 3:51 p.m. MDT October 22, 2015 Skiing in Vail. 71 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Skiers and snowboarders rejoice: Colorado's mountains received more than 10 inches of snow this week. 
It's finally time to talk skiing. 
Whether you're looking for a multi-mountain pass, or a resort friendly for beginners, there's an option out there for you to find some fun on the slopes. Here's your guide to Colorado's ski areas: those close to Fort Collins, local favorites and the Vail Resorts-managed areas on Epic Pass. 
CLOSE TO HOME 
Eldora Mountain Resort 
Powder talk : Closest skiing to Fort Collins, and you avoid the Interstate 70 nightmare. Great place for families and beginners. 
Season : Nov. 20 through mid-April 
Terrain: 680 acres. 30 percent expert/advanced; 50 percent intermediate; 20 percent beginner. 11 lifts, 53 trails, bowl skiing. Summit: 10,800 feet. Base: 9,200 feet. Vertical: 1,600 feet. 300 inches annual snowfall. 
Season pass: Adult super value pass (includes blackout dates) $299; adult off peak pass (includes holiday blackout dates) $339; adult full pass $399; senior full pass (65 and older) $259; junior full pass $259; child full pass $219; student $189; military $259; family pass $999. 
Lift tickets (last year's pricing): Adult full day (16-64) $79; junior full day (6-15) $45; senior full day (65-74) $42; Senior Silver (75 and older) $10; child full day (5 and younger) $10; lower mountain only (6 and up) $54; military full day $44; half-day adult $64. 
Miles from Fort Collins : 75 
Information: www.eldora.com or 303-440-8700 Fort Collins residents must, and will, travel to ski 
Snowy Range (Wyoming) 
Powder talk: Nestled in the Medicine Bow National Forest, Snowy Range is a favorite for University of Wyoming students. Everyone’s friends on the slopes, Rams. Find cheap lift tickets. 
Season: Nov. 27 through April 
Terrain: 250 acres. 40 percent moderate/difficult; 30 percent difficult/advanced; 30 percent easy. Four lifts, 27 trails, two terrain parks. Summit: 10,000 feet. Base: 9,000 feet. Vertical: 1,000 feet. 245 inches annual snowfall. 
Season pass (prices if purchased before Oct. 31): Adult $259; teen (13-17) $219; youth (5-12) $159; student $249; military $249; senior (70 and older) free; children (younger than 5) free. 
Lift tickets: Adult full day $45; teen full day $39; senior full day $42; youth full day $28; student $39; military $39; senior free; children free. Miles from Fort Collins: 100 
Information : www.snowyrangeski.com or 307-745-5750 
Loveland Ski Area 
Powder talk: Unseasonably warm weather has delayed the resort’s opening, but you’ll find plenty of snow at the no-frills resort. 
Season: Opening date unannounced, but typically opens by the first week in November. Lasts until early May. 
Terrain: 1,800 acres. 46 percent expert/advanced; 41 percent intermediate; 13 percent beginner. 10 lifts, 93 trails, one terrain park, bowl skiing. Summit: 13,010 feet. Base: 10,800 feet. Vertical: 2,210 feet. 422 inches annual snowfall. 
Season pass (second price listed is for returning pass holders): Adult (23 and older) $389/$369; young adult (15 to 22) $279/$259; child (6 to 14) $179/$169; children ages 5 and under are free; senior (ages 70 and older) $89 
Lift tickets: Early season adult (15 and older) $53; child (6-14) $25; 5 and younger free; adult Chair 7 (beginner) only ticket $25; child Chair 7 only $20. Regular season adult $65; child $28. Season pass for seniors 70 and older $89. 
Miles from Fort Collins: 116 
Information: www.skiloveland.com or 303-571-5580, 800-736-3754
